snippet: Consumers rarely read the standardized language for online terms and conditions, and experts disagree on their significance.
abstract: Alina Tugend Shortcuts column analyzes proliferation of boilerplate contracts and terms of agreement that most consumers sign without reading; notes while some see such contracts as necessary element of doing business, others warn of distressing trends, including clauses that bar class-action lawsuits and other forms of consumer recourse.
lead_paragraph: Consumers rarely read the standardized language for online terms and conditions, and experts disagree on their significance.

headline.main: Those Wordy Contracts We All So Quickly Accept
headline.print_headline: Those Wordy Contracts We All So Quickly Accept
